name: SSF2
title: Site-Specific Factor 2
subtitle: Size of Metastasis in Lymph Nodes
notes:
**Note:**  Code the size of the largest metastasis in a lymph node as documented in the pathology report, not the size of the lymph node. If the size of the metastasis is not documented, code the size of the largest involved node as documented pathologically or clinically, with pathology taking priority. 

* Do not code the size of any node(s) coded in distant metastasis
rows:
1 - 979 millimeter (mm) 
(Exact size of lymph node metastasis to nearest mm)
Not applicable: Information not collected for this case
Microscopic focus or foci only and no size of focus given
Described as "less than 2 cm" or "greater than 1 cm" or "between 1 cm and 2 cm"
Described as "less than 3 cm" or "greater than 2 cm" or "between 2 cm and 3 cm"
Described as "less than 4 cm" or "greater than 3 cm" or "between 3 cm and 4 cm"
Described as "less than 5 cm" or "greater than 4 cm" or "between 4 cm and 5 cm"
Described as "less than 6 cm" or "greater than 5 cm" or "between 5 cm and 6 cm"

Regional lymph node(s) involved, size not stated
Common iliac node involvement only
Unknown if regional lymph node(s) involved
Not documented in patient record
